Adder's Blessing.name: Adder's Blessing
Adder's Blessing.description: You are immune to poisons and other toxins.

Ambush.name: Ambush
Ambush.description: Your "Marked for Death" feature uses d6s instead of d4s.

Backstab.name: Backstab
Backstab.description: Your "Marked for Death" feature uses d8s instead of d6s.

Chasing Death.name: Chasing Death
Chasing Death.description: While you have 1–3 unmarked Hit Points, you can use your Crimson Rite feature without paying the Hit Point cost. If you have only 1 unmarked Hit Point, you roll d8s instead of d6s for the extra damage of your Crimson Rite.

Circle of Power.name: Circle of Power
Circle of Power.description:
Once per rest, mark a circle on the ground around you up to Very Close range and place a number of tokens equal to your Spellcast Trait on this card. Each time you or any ally within the circle makes an action roll or is hit with an attack, remove a token. This spell lasts until the last token is removed or you step out of the circle. While within this circle, you and any allies:

  • Gain a +4 bonus to your damage thresholds.

  • Gain a +2 bonus to your attack rolls.

  • Gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.

Control the Beast.name: Control the Beast
Control the Beast.description: While in your Wolf Form, you can apply that form’s bonus die to your Agility and Strength Action Rolls.

Dark Aegis.name: Dark Aegis
Dark Aegis.description: Once per long rest, when you would mark any number of Hit Points, you can spend a Favor instead.

Deadly Devotion.name: Deadly Devotion
Deadly Devotion.description: On a successful attack, you can spend a Favor to gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion until you mark a Hit Point or take a rest.

Death Strike.name: Death Strike
Death Strike.description: When you deal Severe damage to a creature, you can mark a Stress to make them mark an additional Hit Point.

Diminish My Foes.name: Diminish My Foes
Diminish My Foes.description: When you succeed with Hope on an action roll against a target, you can spend a Hope to make your target mark a Stress.

Divine Ire.name: Divine Ire
Divine Ire.description: Once per rest, when you take damage, you can spend any number of Favor to target that many adversaries within Close range. Each target must mark a Hit Point.

Draining Bane.name: Draining Bane
Draining Bane.description: When an adversary attacks you or an ally within Very Close range, you can spend 2 Favor to temporarily Drain them. When you do, they must mark a Stress and you can clear a Stress. A Drained creature uses a d12 instead of a d20 for attack rolls.

Draining Invoaction.name: Draining Invoaction
Draining Invoaction.description: When an adversary attacks you or an ally within Very Close range, you can spend a Favor to make them use a d12 instead of a d20 for the attack roll. Additionally, the adversary must mark a Stress, and you can clear a Stress.

Enhanced Hex.name: Enhanced Hex
Enhanced Hex.description: Attacks you make against Hexed creatures gain a damage bonus equal to your Proficiency.

Envenomate.name: Envenomate
Envenomate.description:
On a successful weapon attack, you can spend a token from this card to afflict the target with a known poison’s effect.

  • Gorgon’s Root: The target’s Difficulty gains a permanent -1 penalty. This can only affect them once.

  • Grave Spore: The target must also mark a Stress.

  • Leech Weed: Gain a +1d6 bonus to damage on this attack.

Eye for an Eye.name: Eye for an Eye
Eye for an Eye.description: When you mark more than one Hit Point from an attack in melee range, the attacker must make a Reaction Roll (13). On a failure, once per rest, they immediately mark the same number of Hit Points in return.

cPacNVvx5zNc1FmQ.name: Counterattack
cPacNVvx5zNc1FmQ.description: When you mark more than one Hit Point from an attack in melee range, the attacker must make a Reaction Roll (13). On a failure, once per rest, they immediately mark the same number of Hit Points in return.

Favored Weapon.name: Favored Weapon
Favored Weapon.description: Mark a Stress to Imbue your weapon with your Patron's fury until you deal Severe damage. On a successful Imbued weapon attack, you can spend any number of Favor to gain a +1d6 damage bonus for each Favor spent.

Fearsome Attack.name: Fearsome Attack
Fearsome Attack.description: You can always spend a Favor to reroll any number of your damage dice. You can continue spending Favor to reroll the same dice as many times as you'd like.

Feral Hide.name: Feral Hide
Feral Hide.description: While in your Wolf Form, you gain a bonus to your Damage Thresholds equal to your Tier.

First Strike.name: First Strike
First Strike.description: The first time in a scene you succeed on an attack roll, double the damage of the attack.

Focus.name: Focus
Focus.description:
Click here to roll: [[/r 1d6]].

During a rest, roll a number of d6s equal to your Instinct and place a number of Focus tokens equal to the highest value rolled on this card. Spend a Focus to shift into a stance until you you take Severe damage, the scene ends, you mark your last Hit Point, or you shift into another stance.

Hedge.name: Hedge
Hedge.description: You channel the powers of nature to create both boon and bane.

Herald of Death.name: Herald of Death
Herald of Death.description: When you fail an attack roll, you can spend a Favor to reroll it. If it fails again, mark a Stress and take the new result.

Herbal Remedies.name: Herbal Remedies
Herbal Remedies.description: When you or an ally clear one or more Hit Points or Stress as the result of using a consumable, increase the number cleared by one.

Improved Mutagens.name: Improved Mutagens
Improved Mutagens.description:
When you choose a mutagen benefit, your options also include the following:

  • Nerves of Steel. Whenever you must mark a Stress, you can spend 2 Hope instead.

  • Rapidity. Your Evasion increases by 1.

  • Ironskin. Your Severe damage threshold increases by a number equal to your Proficiency.

Ire of Pale Light.name: Ire of Pale Light
Ire of Pale Light.description: When a Hexed creature within Far range fails an attack roll, they must mark a Stress.

Juggernaut.name: Juggernaut
Juggernaut.description: You have toned your body into a weapon of sheer force, able to take and return mighty blows.

Keen Defenses.name: Keen Defenses
Keen Defenses.description: When you are targeted by an attack, you can spend a Focus to make the adversary’s attack roll have disadvantage.

Limit Breaker.name: Limit Breaker
Limit Breaker.description: Once per rest, you can pull off an unbelievable feat like running across water, leaping between distant rooftops, or scaling the side of a building without needing to roll. When you do, gain a Hope and clear a Stress.

vd31YZgnJkEQSU4d.name: Limit Break
vd31YZgnJkEQSU4d.description: Once per rest, you can pull off an unbelievable feat like running across water, leaping between distant rooftops, or scaling the side of a building without needing to roll. When you do, gain a Hope and clear a Stress.

Lunar Phases.name: Lunar Phases
Lunar Phases.description:
Your spirit ebbs and flows like the phases of the moon. At the beginning of each session, roll a d4 and gain the matching effect until the end of the session:

  • 1: New - You can always spend a Hope to reduce Minor damage to None.

  • 2: Waxing - Gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls.

  • 3: Full - Gain a +2 bonus to your damage thresholds.

  • 4: Waning - Gain a +1 bonus to your Evasion.

2cgsUItFz9IOKDmq.name: Waxing Moon
2cgsUItFz9IOKDmq.description: Gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls.

iKkLKp5rPtl6A0Lc.name: Full Moon
iKkLKp5rPtl6A0Lc.description: Gain a +2 bonus to your damage thresholds.

Lycan Regeneration.name: Lycan Regeneration
Lycan Regeneration.description: While in your Wolf Form with all your Hit Points marked, you can mark a Stress to clear a Hit Point. You can do this while unconscious.

Martial Artist.name: Martial Artist
Martial Artist.description: You have studied and mastered specific fighting styles, letting your moves flow seamelessly in battle.

Martial Form.name: Martial Form
Martial Form.description: You start with two martial stances from Tier 1. When you reach a new tier, take two additional stances at your tier or lower.

Master the Beast.name: Master the Beast
Master the Beast.description:
When you are in your Wolf Form and would mark your last Stress, you can instead put one of your Domain cards from your Loadout into your Vault; you can’t Recall that Domain card until you fi nish a long rest.

When you Frenzy from marking your last Stress while in Wolf Form, you gain 2 Hope.

Mastered Mutagens.name: Mastered Mutagens
Mastered Mutagens.description:
The trait bonus and penalty you get from your Mutagens feature changes to +2 and −2, respectively. When you choose a mutagen benefi t, your options also include the following:

  • Aetherblood. Within your line of sight, you can see creatures and objects that are invisible, and visual illusions appear transparent to you. If a creature or an object within your line of sight has been transformed by magic, you can see its true form.

  • Fury. When you make an attack roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Proficiency.

  • Steelflesh. Your Major damage threshold increases by a number equal to your Proficiency.

Menacing Reach.name: Menacing Reach
Menacing Reach.description: When you Imbue your weapon with your Patron's fury, you can mark an additional Stress to increase its range by one step (Melee to Very Close, Very Close to Close, etc.).

Moon.name: Moon
Moon.description: You channel the powers of the moon to both deceive and protect.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description: Once per session, you can conjure a column of moonlight that illuminates the area within Close range until the end of the scene. While bathed in this moonlight, you and any allies gain a +1 bonus to Spellcast Rolls and advantage on rolls to see through illusions.

zEqPJ7UKSy561b9U.name: Moonbeam
zEqPJ7UKSy561b9U.description: Once per session, you can conjure a column of moonlight that illuminates the area within Close range until the end of the scene. While bathed in this moonlight, you and any allies gain a +1 bonus to Spellcast Rolls and advantage on rolls to see through illusions.

Mutagens.name: Mutagens
Mutagens.description:
You employ mutagenic toxins created to enhance your abilities. When you finish a rest, you can drink one such toxin to gain its effects, which last until you fi nish your next rest. These eff ects include a +1 bonus to one trait of your choice, a −1 penalty to a diff erent trait of your choice, and your choice of one of the following benefi ts:

  • Celerity. If you are Restrained or Vulnerable, you can mark a Stress to end the condition on yourself.

  • Durable. Your Armor Score increases by 2.

  • Hunter’s Senses. You have advantage on any action roll you make to track a creature, and you can see in complete darkness.

Night's Glamour.name: Night's Glamour
Night's Glamour.description:
Mark a Stress to Glamour yourself in a magical facade that lasts until you mark a Hit Point, make an attack, or take a rest. While Glamoured, you can:

  • Disguise yourself to look like any creature of your approximate size that you’ve seen.

  • Enhance your own appearance. You gain advantage on Presence Rolls that leverage this change.

vq6us2ZBcGStBPOe.name: Mark Stress
vq6us2ZBcGStBPOe.description:
Mark a Stress to Glamour yourself in a magical facade that lasts until you mark a Hit Point, make an attack, or take a rest. While Glamoured, you can:

Disguise yourself to look like any creature of your approximate size that you’ve seen.

Enhance your own appearance. You gain advantage on Presence Rolls that leverage this change.

Not Done Yet.name: Not Done Yet
Not Done Yet.description: When you mark more than one HP from an attack, you may gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

HjDHMhLPO0ZnFucy.name: Gain Hope
HjDHMhLPO0ZnFucy.description: When you mark more than one HP from an attack, you may gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

ueQbbXkCceB7uYJZ.name: Clear Stress
ueQbbXkCceB7uYJZ.description: When you mark more than one HP from an attack, you may gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

Overwhelm.name: Overwhelm
Overwhelm.description: On a successful attack, you can spend a Hope to force the target to mark a Stress or to throw them within Close range.

wxX1JhvRDUjEBY4g.name: Stress Damage
wxX1JhvRDUjEBY4g.description: On a successful attack, you can spend a Hope to force the target to mark a Stress or to throw them within Close range.

Patron's Mantle.name: Patron's Mantle
Patron's Mantle.description:
Mark a Stress to cloak yourself in a terrifying aspect of your Patron that lasts until you take Severe damage or the scene ends:

  • When you would mark an Armor Slot, you can spend 2 Favor instead.

  • You gain a bonus equal to your tier on action rolls to intimidate a target.

zjdjIrCA7bTP9sJN.name: Mark a Stress
zjdjIrCA7bTP9sJN.description:
Mark a Stress to transform into a terrifying visage that lasts until you take Severe damage or the scene ends. While transformed:

  • You can spend a Favor in place of an Armor Slot.

  • You have advantage on rolls to intimidate a target.

Poison Compendium.name: Poison Compendium
Poison Compendium.description:
You also know these poisons:

  • Midnight’s Veil: The target gains a permanent -2 penalty to attack rolls. This can only affect them once.

  • Ghost Petal: Permanently decrease the damage dice of the target’s standard attack by one step (d10 to d8, d8 to d6, etc.). This can only affect them once.

Powerhouse.name: Powerhouse
Powerhouse.description: Increase the d8 damage dice for your unarmed attack to d10s. Additionally, you can mark a Stress to target two creatures within Melee range with a single attack roll.

MgrzTu1dsA6lXmMV.name: Mark Stress
MgrzTu1dsA6lXmMV.description: Additionally, you can mark a Stress to target two creatures within Melee range with a single attack roll.

Pummeljoy.name: Pummeljoy
Pummeljoy.description: When you critically succeed on a weapon attack in Melee range, you gain an additional Hope, clear an additional Stress, and gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for the attack.

WcdLyH5rBN5WmkHd.name: Extra healing
WcdLyH5rBN5WmkHd.description: When you critically succeed on a weapon attack in Melee range, you gain an additional Hope, clear an additional Stress, and gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for the attack.

Rugged.name: Rugged
Rugged.description: Gain a permanent +3 bonus to your Severe damage threshold. Additionally, your “Powerhouse” feature can target three creatures instead of two.

0JcKDuNPUlv4Avbc.name: Rugged
0JcKDuNPUlv4Avbc.description: Gain a permanent +3 bonus to your Severe damage threshold.

Scorpion's Poise.name: Scorpion's Poise
Scorpion's Poise.description: You gain a +2 bonus to your Evasion against any attacks made by a creature Marked for Death.

Shadowed Grit.name: Shadowed Grit
Shadowed Grit.description: When the GM gains a Fear from a Duality Dice roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a Hope.

Spectral Form.name: Spectral Form
Spectral Form.description: You have another death move option: Spectral Form. When you choose this option, you clear a Hit Point, your body becomes spectral, you have resistance to physical damage, and you can pass through objects. This form ends if you clear any more Hit Points. It also ends if you mark your last Hit Point, which forces you to take a diff erent death move. You’re shunted to the nearest open space if you’re inside an object when the form ends.

Spirit Blast.name: Spirit Blast
Spirit Blast.description: Spend a Focus to make an Instinct Roll against an adversary within Close range. On a success, you deal d20+3 magic damage using your Proficiency and can spend an additional Focus to make them temporarily Vulnerable.

dIHUBfsBFO0Kei40.name: Spirit Blast
dIHUBfsBFO0Kei40.description: Spend a Focus to make an Instinct Roll against an adversary within Close range. On a success, you deal d20+3 magic damage using your Proficiency and can spend an additional Focus to make them temporarily Vulnerable.

Stance - Brutal.name: Stance - Brutal
Stance - Brutal.description:
Brutal: When you roll the maximum value on a damage die, roll an

additional damage die.

Stance - Compounding.name: Stance - Compounding
Stance - Compounding.description: Compounding: When you roll the maximum value on a Combo Die, increase the size of the subsequent Combo Dice you roll for the attack (at a maximum of d12s).

Stance - Crushing.name: Stance - Crushing
Stance - Crushing.description: Crushing: When you roll a 1 on a damage die, it can be treated as the highest value on the die instead.

Stance - Deadly.name: Stance - Deadly
Stance - Deadly.description: Deadly: When you deal Severe damage, the target marks an additional HP

Stance - Defensive.name: Stance - Defensive
Stance - Defensive.description:
Defensive: Attack rolls against you have disadvantage unless the

adversary marks a Stress.

Stance - Deflecting.name: Stance - Deflecting
Stance - Deflecting.description: Deflecting: When you are targeted by an attack, you can spend 2 Focus to gain a bonus to your Evasion equal to your Armor Score against the attack.

Stance - Devastating.name: Stance - Devastating
Stance - Devastating.description: Devastating: Spend a Focus before your attack roll to use d20s as your damage dice instead.

Stance - Discerning.name: Stance - Discerning
Stance - Discerning.description: Discerning: You may choose the target of your attack after making your attack roll. The GM will tell you who the attack would succeed against.

Stance - Dueling.name: Stance - Dueling
Stance - Dueling.description: Dueling: Gain advantage on attack rolls when there are no other adversaries or allies in Very Close range of you or your target.

Stance - Favored.name: Stance - Favored
Stance - Favored.description: Favored: Add the trait of your choice to your damage roll.

Stance - Grappling.name: Stance - Grappling
Stance - Grappling.description: Grappling: On a successful attack, you can spend a Focus to make the target temporarily Restrained.

Stance - Hindering.name: Stance - Hindering
Stance - Hindering.description: Hindering: On a successful attack, you can spend a Focus to make the target temporarily Hindered. While Hindered, their attack rolls have a -2 penalty.

Stance - Immovable.name: Stance - Immovable
Stance - Immovable.description: Immovable: Gain a +2 bonus to your damage thresholds and you cannot be moved unwillingly.

Stance - Inexorable.name: Stance - Inexorable
Stance - Inexorable.description: Inexorable: Attacks against you have disadvantage if you have more than two adversaries within Melee of you.

Stance - Infuriating.name: Stance - Infuriating
Stance - Infuriating.description: Infuriating: On a successful attack, the target becomes Furious. While Furious, they are Vulnerable and have a -2 penalty to their attack rolls. They can only clear Furious by succeeding on an attack against you.

Stance - Invigorating.name: Stance - Invigorating
Stance - Invigorating.description: Invigorating: When you make a successful attack, roll a d4. On a 4, gain a Focus.

Stance - Nimble.name: Stance - Nimble
Stance - Nimble.description: Nimble: When an adversary makes a successful attack roll against you, you can spend a number of Focus up to your Tier. Roll a number of d6s equal to 1 + the Focus spent. If any of the dice values match, you take no damage from the attack.

Stance - Otherworldly.name: Stance - Otherworldly
Stance - Otherworldly.description: Otherworldly: You can choose whether to do Physical or Magic damage.

Stance - Precise.name: Stance - Precise
Stance - Precise.description: Precise: Gain a +1 bonus to your attack rolls.

Stance - Quick.name: Stance - Quick
Stance - Quick.description: Quick: When making an attack roll, spend a Focus to include an additional target within range.

Stance - Scary.name: Stance - Scary
Stance - Scary.description: Scary: Successful attacks also force the target to mark a Stress.

Stance - Sheltering.name: Stance - Sheltering
Stance - Sheltering.description: Sheltering: When you mark an Armor Slot, it reduces damage for you and all allies within Melee range of you who took the same damage.

Stance - Steady.name: Stance - Steady
Stance - Steady.description:
Steady: Gain a -1 penalty to your Evasion. When you deal damage on a

successful attack, roll an additional damage die and drop the lowest.

Stance - Sweeping.name: Stance - Sweeping
Stance - Sweeping.description: Sweeping: Your attack targets all adversaries within Very Close range. Deal half damage to all targets you succeed against.

Tethered Talisman.name: Tethered Talisman
Tethered Talisman.description: Once per rest, you can imbue a small item with your protective essence. When the person holding the talisman takes damage, you can expend its magic to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by one. You can’t create a new talisman until the old one has been used.

JvGfIDjfeKa26pr1.name: Tether
JvGfIDjfeKa26pr1.description: Once per rest, you can imbue a small item with your protective essence. When the person holding the talisman takes damage, you can expend its magic to reduce the number of Hit Points they mark by one. You can’t create a new talisman until the old one has been used.

Toxic Concoctions.name: Toxic Concoctions
Toxic Concoctions.description:
Mark a Stress to add [[/r 1d4+1]] tokens to this card. On your next long rest, clear this card. You know these poisons:

  • Gorgon’s Root: The target’s Difficulty gains a permanent -1 penalty. This can only affect them once.

  • Grave Spore: The target must also mark a Stress.

  • Leech Weed: Gain a +1d6 bonus to damage on this attack.

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description: Once per long rest, when you fail an attack roll, you can spend a Hope to make it a success instead.

Twin Fang.name: Twin Fang
Twin Fang.description: When you afflict a target with a known poison’s effect, you can spend an additional token to inflict the effect of a second known poison.

Veilwalker.name: Veilwalker
Veilwalker.description: You can briefl y slip into the realm between the living and the dead. Spend 2 Hope to disappear and then reappear next to a creature or a corpse within Far range. You then have advantage on the next attack roll you make in this scene.

Venomancer.name: Venomancer
Venomancer.description:
You also know these poisons:

  • Blight Seed: The target gains a permanent -3 penalty to their damage thresholds. This can only affect them once.

  • Fear Leaf: The damage from this attack gains a bonus equal to the result of your Fear Die.

Volatile Toxins.name: Volatile Toxins
Volatile Toxins.description: You can choose two mutagen benefits instead of one. If you do, mark a Hit Point that can’t be cleared until you finish your next rest.

Walk Between Worlds.name: Walk Between Worlds
Walk Between Worlds.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (13) to step beyond the veil of death and converse with any nearby spirits. Place a number of tokens equal to your Spellcast trait on this card and remove one each time a spirit answers a question. You return to the mortal realm when the last token is removed.

oaWeFrfXwY2yEUEd.name: Converse with Spirits
oaWeFrfXwY2yEUEd.description: Make a Spellcast Roll (13) to step beyond the veil of death and converse with any nearby spirits. Place a number of tokens equal to your Spellcast trait on this card and remove one each time a spirit answers a question. You return to the mortal realm when the last token is removed.

Werewolf.name: Werewolf
Werewolf.description: You gain the Werewolf Transformation card. Your rolls to perceive via hearing and scent have advantage.
